metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3706 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the getaddrinfo function in sysdeps/posix/getaddrinfo.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving hostent conversion. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2013-4458. Michael Petlan discovered an unbounded stack allocation in the getaddrinfo() function of the GNU C Library. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3706` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu6
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu6
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu6
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu6
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> other versions of fixes in glibc bug report reverted in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS due to breaking IPv6 name resolution

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu6').
